definitions.text: not easy; requiring great physical or mental effort to accomplish or comprehend or endure
examples: nesting places on the cliffs are difficult of access
why is it so hard for you to keep a secret?

definitions.text: dispassionate
resisting weight or pressure
very strong or vigorous
examples: a hard left to the chin

definitions.text: characterized by effort to the point of exhaustion; especially physical effort
examples: worked their arduous way up the mining valley
spent many laborious hours on the project

definitions.text: produced without vibration of the vocal cords
examples: unvoiced consonants such as `p' and `k' and `s'

definitions.text: (of light) transmitted directly from a pointed light source
(of speech sounds); produced with the back of the tongue raised toward or touching the velum
examples: Russian distinguished between hard consonants and palatalized or soft consonants

definitions.text: given to excessive indulgence of bodily appetites especially for intoxicating liquors
being distilled rather than fermented; having a high alcoholic content
unfortunate or hard to bear
dried out
examples: hard dry rolls left over from the day before

definitions.text: with effort or force or vigor
with firmness
earnestly or intently
causing great damage or hardship
examples: industries hit hard by the depression
she was severely affected by the bank's failure

definitions.text: slowly and with difficulty
indulging excessively
into a solid condition
examples: concrete that sets hard within a few hours

definitions.text: very near or close in space or time
examples: it stands hard by the railroad tracks
they were hard on his heels
a strike followed hard upon the plant's opening

definitions.text: with pain or distress or bitterness
examples: he took the rejection very hard

definitions.text: to the full extent possible; all the way
